title: Thunderbird for Android - Local Folders copy from desktop ?
creator: moz17
content: Hello. I successfully copied my email accounts into TB for Android app on my phone. I had hoped that I could elect to copy over my Local (desktop) Folders too. It didn't have the option. I'm sure I can copy the Local Folders to my phone's SD card. Q: What app would you recommend I use to find and read these emails ? Would the TB for A app be able to do this ? Thanks for reading. Pete Smith, UK.

title: contacts (carddav)
creator: spam51
content: I want to use Thunderbird for Android and connected my mailbox with imap and smtp. So far so good. But i dont see a adresboek and i dont know where to connect my carddav addressbook. Can you help me?

title: I have Thunderbird Android and it changed to Apple
creator: adrian51
content: I have Thunderbird Android and it changed to Apple when we bought Apple TV and now we cannot send. Were forced to use crap Webmail. Can you help as our provider has tried many times and now we are getting in an expensive IT guy but if you know what wrong please reply [edited from public] @Dobinson.info & [edited from public support forum] @Ofplan.org

title: Do not tell you users to post to the idea forum
creator: jidanni
content: Messages are left there for weeks and weeks without a moderator getting around to approve them. Yes I'm talking about https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/premod/moderationitemspage/tab/unmoderated:idea

title: Move the number away from the date
creator: jidanni
content:
Tell somebody, to please move the message account number, away from right next to the date, where it seems to be part of the date.

It could be moved over to the left, whether it's this nice big space. How about that?

No, I posted to the ideas forum but there is no moderator, so nobody will ever approve any messages there.
